results.title: These Doctors Admit They Don’t Want Patients With Disabilities
results.abstract: When granted anonymity in focus groups, physicians let their guards down and shared opinions consistent with experiences of many people with disabilities.

media.caption: Lisa Iezzoni, a professor of medicine at Harvard, wanted to understand why people with disabilities kept reporting receiving substandard care. “I thought I needed to start talking to doctors,” she said.

results.title: Half the World Has a Clitoris. Why Don’t Doctors Study It?
results.abstract: The organ is “completely ignored by pretty much everyone,” medical experts say, and that omission can be devastating to women’s sexual health.

results.title: Why So Many Celebrities Are Moving to Brooklyn Heights
results.abstract: With stately townhouses and a cute bakery, Brooklyn Heights is shaping up to be the next West Village.

results.title: For Broadway’s ‘1776’ Revival, the Drama Is Offstage

results.adx_keywords: Travel and Vacations;Palaces and Castles;Hotels and Travel Lodgings;Ireland;Galway (Ireland);County Tipperary (Ireland);County Kilkenny (Ireland);County Louth (Ireland)
results.title: An Irish Castle to Call Your Own
results.abstract: To most, the striking stone towers that dot the Irish countryside are quaint ruins. To a few ambitious people, they’re the perfect places to make into homes — and one-of-a-kind vacation rentals.

media.caption: The newly renovated Drummond Tower was built by a wealthy landowner in 1858 in remembrance of his mother. Four small rooms are stacked atop each other; a timber roof deck offers panoramic farmland views.

results.adx_keywords: Senses and Sensation;Ice;Saunas and Sweat Lodges;Water;Lakes;Photography;Maine
results.title: Cold-Plunging With Maine’s ‘Ice Mermaids’
results.abstract: A photographer in Maine has been documenting groups of women who submerge themselves in near-freezing water. Here’s what she’s seen.

media.caption: Ida Lennestål in one of three plunges during an ice-dip session. “After the initial hurdle of getting into the water, everything slows down — the breath, the heart, the buzz of the brain,” she said.
